intro: Camissonia boothii subsp. condensata, commonly known as the dense camissonia, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat. This subspecies is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
